name: Mournwhelk
text:
When Mournwhelk enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
Evoke {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

editions.flavor: It hoards Lorwyn's rare sorrows.

name: Mournwillow
text:
Haste
Delirium — When Mournwillow enters the battlefield, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, creatures with power 2 or less can't block this turn.

name: Mouth of Ronom
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}{S}, {T}, Sacrifice Mouth of Ronom: Mouth of Ronom deals 4 damage to target creature. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

name: Mouth to Mouth
text: You and target opponent have a breath-holding contest. If you win, you gain control of target creature that player controls.

editions.flavor: Interesting tidbit: Surveys show that the card Ow has one of the most popular pieces of flavor text in the Unglued expansion.

name: Mox Diamond
text:
If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Mox Emerald
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

name: Mox Jet
text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

text:
{T}: Add {∞} to your mana pool.
{100}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
You don't lose life due to mana burn.

name: Mox Opal
text: Metalcraft — {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

editions.flavor: The suns of Mirrodin have shone upon perfection only once.
The suns of Mirrodin have shone upon perfection only once.
On loan from a private collection, this unique mechanism extracts power from a carefully prepared gemstone.

name: Mox Pearl
text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

name: Mox Ruby
text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

name: Mox Sapphire
text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Mtenda Griffin
text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Return Mtenda Griffin to its owner's hand and return target Griffin card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor: "Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Mtenda Herder
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination."
—Mangara

name: Mtenda Lion
text: Whenever Mtenda Lion attacks, defending player may pay {U}. If that player does, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by Mtenda Lion this turn.

editions.flavor:
"The lion drank that lake right up! In thanks, he gave Siti the power to speak with lions and make them leave the goats alone."
—Afari, Tales

name: Muck Drubb
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Muck Drubb enters the battlefield, change the target of target spell that targets only a single creature to Muck Drubb.
Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor: The difference between a nuisance and a threat is often merely a matter of numbers.

"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Alaborn soldier

"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

name: Mudbrawler Cohort
text:
Haste
Mudbrawler Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another red creature.

editions.flavor: Before a raid, the members of Wort's gang egg each other on with tales of their hunger and what they'll do to sate it, each outdoing the last.

name: Mudbrawler Raiders
text: Mudbrawler Raiders can't be blocked by blue creatures.

editions.flavor: To reach the ravine of the Wanderbrine River, they were told to take the shortcut "through the mountains." They took the directions literally.

name: Mudbutton Clanger
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Mudbutton Clanger, you may reveal it. If you do, Mudbutton Clanger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.
The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.

Counter target instant or sorcery spell.

name: Mudhole
text: Target player exiles all land cards from his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: "Doing okay back there, Tarv? Tarv?"

name: Mudslide
text:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

name: Mugging
text: Mugging deals 2 damage to target creature. That creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Scream: muffled. Pockets: emptied. Neck function: never the same again.

name: Mulch
text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.
Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.
The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.
The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.

name: Mul Daya Channelers
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is a creature card, Mul Daya Channelers gets +3/+3.
As long as the top card of your library is a land card, Mul Daya Channelers has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."

name: Mulldrifter
text:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Multani
text: Creatures you control get +X/+0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: In mentoring apprentice mages, the forest spirit Multani teaches each to respect nature while making use of its gifts. Multani taught Gerrard, Mirri, and Rofellos to hone their spellcasting in tandem with more physical disciplines so that both would be improved.

name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.

editions.flavor:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza

name: Multani's Acolyte
text:
Echo {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Multani's Acolyte enters the battlefield, draw a card.

name: Multani's Decree
text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

editions.flavor:
"This is my place of power. Nothing can take root here unless I allow it."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Multani's Harmony
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: "Welcome to paradise."

name: Multani's Presence
text: Whenever a spell you've cast is countered, draw a card.

editions.flavor: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.

name: Multiform Wonder
text:
When Multiform Wonder enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}: Multiform Wonder gains your choice of flying, vigilance, or lifelink until end of turn.
Pay {E}: Multiform Wonder gets +2/-2 or -2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Munda, Ambush Leader
text:
Haste
Rally — Whenever Munda, Ambush Leader or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may look at the top four cards of your library. If you do, reveal any number of Ally cards from among them, then put those cards on top of your library in any order and the rest on the bottom in any order.

name: Munda's Vanguard
text: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

editions.flavor: "Do not let yourselves fall now. Zendikar is depending on us—on you!"
"Do not let yourselves fall now. Zendikar is depending on us—on you!"

name: Mundungu
text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants."
—Tuwile, mundungu of Aku

name: Mungha Wurm
text: You can't untap more than one land during your untap step.

editions.flavor: Cities have crumbled under its weight.

name: Muraganda Petroglyphs
text: Creatures with no abilities get +2/+2.

editions.flavor: Some mages forsake their scrolls and libraries to learn at the feet of ancient trees and sacred stones.

name: Murasa
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, target land becomes a 4/4 creature that's still a land.

name: Murasa Pyromancer
text: Whenever Murasa Pyromancer or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Murasa Pyromancer deal damage to target creature equal to the number of Allies you control.

editions.flavor: "Fire is my accomplice. For enough coin, it can be yours as well."

name: Murasa Ranger
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {3}{G}. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Murasa Ranger.

editions.flavor: "If you're not prepared to fight, you'd best be prepared to die."

name: Murder
text: Destroy target creature.

editions.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."

name: Murderer's Axe
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Equip—Discard a card.

editions.flavor: Though the first who raised it in a fit of passion is long dead, the axe still carries memories of bitter scorn.

name: Murder Investigation
text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature dies, create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens, where X is its power.

editions.flavor: "Every death has a web of consequences. Our job is to find the spider."
"Every death has a web of consequences. Our job is to find the spider."

name: Murder of Crows
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

editions.flavor: Even more than carrion, they crave the last words of the dying.

name: Murderous Betrayal
text: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: In darkness, the assassin sneaked into the village and destroyed what Eladamri loved most: his daughter.
Which hurts more: a sword in the gut or a dagger in the back?

name: Murderous Compulsion
text:
Destroy target tapped creature.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor: "Thank you. This blade becomes so hot in my hand, but your blood has quenched it."

name: Murderous Cut
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Destroy target creature.

editions.flavor: The blades of a Sultai assassin stab like the fangs of a dragon.

name: Murderous Redcap
text:
When Murderous Redcap enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Murderous Redcap Avatar
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control with a counter on it, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: SHM Participation Avatar

name: Murderous Spoils
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that was attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.

text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

Devoid (This card has no color.)

text: Defender

—Lazav

text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of cards named Muscle Burst in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: As strong as a centaur's will.

text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.

name: Musician
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.

name: Mutagenic Growth
text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

name: Mutant's Prey
text: Target creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: Every street corner is a hunting ground, every citizen potential prey.

name: Mutavault
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mutavault becomes a 2/2 creature with all creature types until end of turn. It's still a land.

editions.flavor: Some worlds possess a hidden core where life's essence constantly surges.
Some changelings born at Velis Vel never return, but their essence never leaves.

name: Mutilate
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

editions.flavor:
"It's only torture if you're strong enough to survive. Otherwise, it's a simple, gruesome death. I'm happy either way."
—Liliana Vess

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

"They appreciate my handiwork. I hear their joy in every scream."

name: Mutual Epiphany
text: When you encounter Mutual Epiphany, each player draws four cards. (Then planeswalk away from this phenomenon.)

name: Muzzio's Preparations
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Each creature you control with the chosen name enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Muzzio, Visionary Architect
text: {3}{U}, {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the highest converted mana cost among artifacts you control. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Muzzle
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Mwonvuli Acid-Moss
text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Life gives way to death, and death to new life. Nature feeds upon her own decay."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Mwonvuli Beast Tracker
text: When Mwonvuli Beast Tracker enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with deathtouch, hexproof, reach, or trample and reveal it. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

editions.flavor: "The more dangerous, the better."

name: Mwonvuli Ooze
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay {2} for each age counter on it.)
Mwonvuli Ooze's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus twice the number of age counters on it.

editions.flavor: "Ewww!"

name: Mycoid Shepherd
text: Whenever Mycoid Shepherd or another creature you control with power 5 or greater dies, you may gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: As pure mana flooded across the shards, it brought a sense of unity even to Jund's vicious food chain.

name: Mycologist
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Mycologist.
Remove three spore counters from Mycologist: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

name: Mycoloth
text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each +1/+1 counter on Mycoloth.

name: Mycosynth Fiend
text: Mycosynth Fiend gets +1/+1 for each poison counter your opponents have.

editions.flavor:
"I wish I could take credit for it, but nature progresses on its own, just the way it should."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Mycosynth Golem
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Artifact creature spells you cast have affinity for artifacts. (They cost {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

name: Mycosynth Lattice
text:
All permanents are artifacts in addition to their other types.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are colorless.
Players may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.

name: Mycosynth Wellspring
text: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.
The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.
The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.

name: My Crushing Masterstroke
text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of all nonland permanents your opponents control until end of turn. Untap those permanents. They gain haste until end of turn. Each of them attacks its owner this turn if able.

name: My First Tome
text: {1}, {T}: Say the flavor text on a card in your hand. Target opponent guesses that card's name. You may reveal that card. If you do and your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card.

editions.flavor: This card is named My First Tome.

name: My Genius Knows No Bounds
text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, you gain X life and draw X cards.

editions.flavor: "I can see . . . everything. The beginning and the end of time. The raw edges of reality. And now I see exactly how to kill you."

name: Myojin of Cleansing Fire
text:
Myojin of Cleansing Fire enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Cleansing Fire has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.

—Pontifex, elder researcher
